intro: Hieracium acutiussimoides, commonly known as the sharp-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium acutiussimoides is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
